title: How to Make a Simple Atlatl

steps.title: Find a straight branch with a hook shape on the end of it.
steps.content: Find a straight branch with a hook shape on the end of it. The main branch should be the length of the user's forearm and hand. The end with the small hook will be where the spear attaches to.

steps.title: Cut the hook shape down to be about one inch long and one quarter inch wide.
steps.content: Cut the hook shape down to be about one inch long and one quarter inch wide.

steps.title: Now you can sand down, add a handle, decorate, or apply laquer and paint.
steps.content: Now you can sand down, add a handle, decorate, or apply laquer and paint.

steps.title: Finally, attach the store-bought or homemade dart to hook, and you're ready!
steps.content: Finally, attach the store-bought or homemade dart to hook, and you're ready!

steps.title: Find a straight branch.
steps.content: Find a straight branch. The main branch should be the length of the user's forearm and hand. No hook this time.

steps.title: At one end, take a knife and split down the middle about three inches.
steps.content: At one end, take a knife and split down the middle about three inches.

steps.title: Find a small twig and carefully shape it into a wedge.
steps.content: Find a small twig and carefully shape it into a wedge.

steps.title: Now, force the wedge into the split from step #2.
steps.content: Now, force the wedge into the split from step #2. Force it down until it separates the two sides of the stick about one inch.

steps.title: Leaving the wedge in the stick, drill two small holes in the stick, one on each split end, down about one half inch from the top.
steps.content: Leaving the wedge in the stick, drill two small holes in the stick, one on each split end, down about one half inch from the top.

steps.title: Thread heavy duty string through the two holes, and secure it so that it forms a "bridge" from one split to the other split.
steps.content: Thread heavy duty string through the two holes, and secure it so that it forms a "bridge" from one split to the other split.

steps.title: Store bought darts and the arrow nocks.
steps.content: Store bought darts and the arrow nocks. Glue one arrow nock down each of the hollow dart ends.

steps.title: Now you can sand down, add a handle, decorate, or apply laquer and paint to the atlatl.
steps.content: Now you can sand down, add a handle, decorate, or apply laquer and paint to the atlatl.

steps.title: Finally, attach the knocked dart to the string bridge, and you're ready!
steps.content: Finally, attach the knocked dart to the string bridge, and you're ready!
